Additionally, the court was a place of power and influence, and the literature of the time often reflected the political and social dynamics of the court. Courtly romance, political intrigue, and the complexities of court life were common themes in Heian literature, further emphasizing the significance of the court as a setting.

In conclusion, courts were not an unusual setting for Heian literature; in fact, they were a central and integral setting for many of the most important works of the period. The literature of the Heian period was deeply intertwined with court culture and courtly life, and the court served as a rich and complex backdrop for the literary works of the time.
